page.title: 16"Bowcombe"-Day in the Life 1
page.content: The day for one farmer's wife begins "seldom before 8 unless he needs a packed lunch. Then I shower, dress my little girl and get breakfast. The day may be taken up with housework or gardening. Two days a week I either go to a friend's for the day or she comes to me. Being isolated, my daughter would seldom see children otherwise." Keeping home and looking after her two year old is a full time job. Nevertheless, she finds time for work with the NSPCC. "When I left work I picked one such society that I could support properly. Now that my time is more flexible I can devote some of it to this. I also belong to the Island's Conservative Ladies Association." "I go to Aerobics when I can and read a lot. It doesn't sound very exciting does it? But its very fulfilling and it keeps me happy."
